Legal_Issue: Credible implausibility findings by Refugee Protection Division
Evidence_Assessment: RPD's assessment based on time gap and contradictory traditions without verifiable evidence
Decision_Outcome: RPD initially rejected claim based on implausibility
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish credibility and risk upon claim
Credibility_Factor: Applicants' story of blood feud in Albania
Legal_Rule: Implausibility findings must be supported by reliable evidence and consider cultural context; speculation invalidates findings
Procedural_Issue: Lack of procedural fairness due to speculative reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to blood feud in Albania
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD failed to provide fair assessment based on unsupported speculation
Key_Evidence_Considered: Narrative of blood feud, time gap in events, alleged cultural contradictions
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination system under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged RPD's credibility and implausibility findings
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on credibility and implausibility
Defendant_Response: RPD argued implausibility based on internal inconsistencies
Remedy_Requested: Setting aside of RPD decision and referral for new hearing
Outcome: Claim not determined on merits; referred back for re-hearing
Remedy_Sought: Re-determination by a different RPD panel
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: None – claim based on fear of persecution
Applicable_Process: Refugee claim determination and judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: Error found, decision quashed, case remitted
Governing_Rule: Implausibility cannot be based on speculation; requires evidentiary foundation and cultural sensitivity
